Subjective: Left ear pain, feels like water in ear, hearing impairment. Pain worse after showering. Pain level 4/10 daily, 6-7/10 after showering. No fever or feeling ill overall. Request: Wants pain to stop. Concern: Worried about hearing impairment in left ear.
Objective: Temp 36.2Â°C. Right ear: normal, eardrum intact. Left ear: painful when pulled, red and inflamed, ear canal swollen, red and thick, eardrum not well visualized.
Assessment: Left ear canal inflammation, likely due to frequent wetting and cotton bud use.
Plan: 1. Take paracetamol up to 4000mg/day as needed for pain.
2. Use anti-inflammatory ear drops 3 times/day for 1 week.
3. Stop cleaning ears with cotton buds.
4. Keep left ear dry for the next week.
5. Follow up in 1 week for re-evaluation.
